ygData.subject: Re: dual weild
ygData.msgSnippet: I remember when I couldn t WAIT for dual wield :) This is how I understand it:  Every time your primary weapon swings, you make a dual wield skill check.  IT
ygData.messageBody:
I remember when I couldn't WAIT for dual wield :)

This is how I understand it: Every time your primary weapon swings, you
make a dual wield skill check. IT MAKES NO DIFFERENCE WHAT THE DELAY IS
ON THE WEAPON YOU HAVE IN YOUR SECONDARY HAND.. Many people I know use a
really low delay weapon in their primary and the higher damage, higher
delay weapon in their secondary, because they'll get that many more
chances to swing.

If I were you, I'd put at least 5 or 10 practice points into dual wield,
as with any other skill it goes up VERY slowly at first. Once you hit 50
or so you'll watch it go up a LOT quicker.

At 23, I'm using a PGT in my primary hand and a Barbed Leather Whip in my
secondary, that is when I'm not using all-instrument attack.


I got my first piece of Lambent today! :) Thanks to my roommate and a
guildmate who gave me a lambent stone, I got one Lambent bracer, which
will be my ONLY lambent for a long time, I'm sure, till I can start
getting the components myself :)

.....................................Selianth Jongleure
..The Divine Alliance
..Bard of 23 Songs (*sigh* still)
..Cazic-Thule server

Beth Frantz "The musician's art is to send light
beth@... into the depths of men's hearts"
--Robert Schumann

On Mon, 15 Nov 1999, Christopher Andrews wrote:

> From: "Christopher Andrews" <cmandy_drew@...>
>
> Hello Bards and friends,
> Seeing that I'm nearing lvl 17, i was curious about a few things
> really...
>
> 1) What is a good strategy to use while dual weilding?
>
> 2) I'm currently equipped with a PGT (dmg 6 del 24, berserker str proc wt 6)
> and SBS (shield of course will go bye bye), and a Pugius Dagger (dmg 5 del
> 21 wt 2.?) which I use to hone my piercing skills after the PGT has already
> proc'd. [BTW, i realize that proc means cast, but what does it stand for or
> mean? =)] So will weilding both of these drain my stamina too quickly you
> think?
>
